question.text: A fighter plane of length 20 m, wing span (distance from tip of one wing to the tip of the other wing) of 15 m and height 5 m is flying towards east over Delhi. Its speed is <math><mn>240</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><msup><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo>.</mo></math> The earth's magnetic field over Delhi is <math><mn>5</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></msup><mi>T</mi></math> with the declination angle <math><mo>~</mo><msup><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>o</mi></mrow></msup></math> and dip of <math><mi>θ</mi></math> such that <math><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">sin</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>.</mo></mrow></mrow><mi> </mi></math>If the voltage developed is <math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub></math> between the lower and upper side of the plane and <math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub></math> between the tips of the wings then <math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mi> </mi><mi>a</mi><mi>n</mi><mi>d</mi><mi> </mi><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub></math> are close to :

options.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>40 </mn><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>135</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mi> </mi></math> with left side of pilot at higher voltage

<math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>45</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi></math>  with right side of pilot at higher voltage

<math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>40</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>135</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi></math>  with right side of pilot at high voltage

<math><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>45</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi><mo>;</mo><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>120</mn><mi> </mi><mi>m</mi><mi>V</mi></math> with left side of pilot at higher voltage

solution.text:
V B = B H 5 2 4 0

B H = B cos θ, ....

Bv=Bsinθ

B H = 5 5 × 1 0 - 5 3

B v = 1 0 3 × 1 0 - 5 T

V B = 5 5 3 × 1 0 - 5 × 5 × 2 4 0

V B = 44.6 mV = 4 5 mV

V w = B v ℓ V  = 10 3 × 10 −5 ×15×240

= 1 0 - 4 × 1 2 0 0

V w = 1 2 0 mV

(left side at fighter voltage)
